recipe.ingredients: - large cremini or button mushrooms: 16 - extra-virgin olive oil: 2 tablespoons - garlic (minced): 2 cloves - spinach (chopped): 1 cup - feta cheese (crumbled): 1/2 cup - black olives (chopped): 1/4 cup - sun-dried tomatoes (chopped): 1/4 cup - fresh basil (chopped): 1 tablespoon - almond meal: 2 tablespoons - lemon zest: 1 teaspoon - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/8 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Mushrooms: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Remove stems from mushrooms and finely chop the stems. Set the mushroom caps aside. 2. Cook Filling: In a skillet over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the chopped mushroom stems and garlic, sautéing for 2-3 minutes or until softened. Add spinach and cook until it wilts. 3. Mix Ingredients: Remove skillet from heat. Stir in feta cheese, black olives, sun-dried tomatoes, basil, almond meal, and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper. 4. Stuff Mushrooms: Fill each mushroom cap with the spinach and feta mixture, pressing it in to stuff well. 5. Bake: Arrange the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the tops are lightly golden. 6. Serve Warm: Allow the mushrooms to cool slightly before serving them to your guests.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 5g, Dietary Fiber: 1g, Sodium: 200mg, Saturated Fat: 2g, Total Fat: 7g, Protein: 4g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 2g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 640 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient (based on USDA Food API): Cremini/Button Mushrooms: 4 calories each x 16 = 64 calories Extra-Virgin Olive Oil: 119 calories per tablespoon x 2 = 238 calories Garlic: 9 calories for 2 cloves Spinach: 7 calories per cup Feta Cheese: 198 calories per 1/2 cup Black Olives: 34 calories per 1/4 cup Sun-Dried Tomatoes: 35 calories per 1/4 cup Fresh Basil: Negligible Almond Meal: 40 calories per 2 tablespoons Lemon Zest: Negligible Salt and Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 8 (2 mushrooms per person)
